Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Acceptable Uncertainty in Skipping Intravenous Thrombolysis Before Endovascular Treatment

Intervention.evidence: comparing IVT+EVT (standard care) with EVT alone (experimental arm)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the acceptable level of uncertainty for skipping intravenous thrombolysis (IVT) before endovascular treatment (EVT) in stroke patients directly admitted to EVT-capable centers.

Method_Outcome.evidence: where both arms achieved similar functional independence at 90 days

Number_Randomised.evidence: Out of 600 invited participants, 180 responded (response rate: 30%)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median acceptable uncertainty for reasonable comparability was an absolute difference of 3% in the rate of day 90 functional independence (mode 5%, IQR 1–5%). Interventionalists chose higher margins (aOR 2.20, 95% CI 1.06 to 4.67).
